Protein structure diagram.

Source: R/plot_prot.R
plot_prot.Rd

Plots a diagram of protein structure based on hmmscan domain annotation and several types of predictions.

plot_prot(sequence, id, hyp_col = "#868686FF", gpi_col = "#0073C2FF",
  nsp_col = "#CD534CFF", ag_col = "#E5E5E5FF", tm_col = "#EFC000FF",
  hyp = TRUE, gpi = c("bigpi", "predgpi", "none"), nsp = TRUE,
  ag = TRUE, tm = TRUE, domain = TRUE, disorder = FALSE,
  dom_sort = c("ievalue", "abc", "cba"), progress = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

sequence

String representing a protein amino acid sequence.
id

String representing a protein identifier. Will be converted using make.names
hyp_col

Plotting color of predicted hydroxyproline positions. At default set to: '#868686FF'.
gpi_col

Plotting color of the predicted omega site (glycosylphosphatidylinositol attachment). At default set to: '#0073C2FF'.
nsp_col

Plotting color of the N-terminal signal peptide. At default set to: '#CD534CFF'.
ag_col

Plotting color of the AG glycomodul spans. At default set to: '#E5E5E5FF'.
tm_col

Plotting color of the transmembrane regions. At default set to: '#EFC000FF'.
hyp

Bolean, should hydroxyprolines be plotted.
gpi

A string indicating if get_big_pi (gpi = "bigpi") or get_pred_gpi (gpi = "predgpi") should be called when predicting omega sites. To turn off omega site prediction use gpi = "none". At default set to "bigpi".
nsp

Bolean, should the N-terminal signal peptide be plotted.
ag

Bolean, should the AG glycomodul spans be plotted.
tm

Bolean, should the transmembrane regions be plotted.
domain

Bolean, should the domains be plotted.
disorder

Bolean, should disordered regions be plotted.
dom_sort

One of c("ievalue", "abc", "cba"), defaults to "abc". Domain plotting order. If 'ievalue' domains with the lowest ievalue as determined by hmmscan will be plotted above. If 'abc' or 'cba' the order is determined by domain Names.
progress

Bolean, whether to show the progress bar, at default set to FALSE.
...

Appropriate arguments passed to get_signalp, get_espritz, predict_hyp and scan_ag.

Value

A ggplot2 plot object

See also

get_signalp get_phobius get_hmm get_espritz predict_hyp scan_ag

Examples

library(ragp)
library(ggplot2)
#> Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 3.5.2
ind <- c(23, 5, 80, 81, 345)
pred <- plot_prot(sequence = at_nsp$sequence[ind],
                  id = at_nsp$Transcript.id[ind])
pred +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom",
        legend.direction = "vertical")
